title: JamesBorn
author: JamesBorn
content: Bitcoin project was a good initiatives and over time the project has place smiles in the faces of its communities. We believe the project is good and we fall in love with it, bitcoin became part of your career history but now this phase of the project is not pleasing to everyone weather member or not. Those who don't trust the project has withdrew from the communities but because we are families of bitcoin we still believe and trust in the project hookline and sinker. What about you? Do you still believe the project will live better? What's your percentage trust?

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: If I believed in Bitcoin then, why would I not today? Nothing much has changed fundamentally in the first place. I'd still be owning bitcoin even a country as big as the United States would ban it.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: The bitcoin project has gained a massive track record of success in the past 10 years since its creation and Bitcoin as a fundamental financial tool has helped to liberate the whole world from the grip of the traditional financial system where citizens have no right over the money and a central bank being the sole controller of the fiat currency circulation. But then we can overlook the fact that some investors have failed to understand the fojndanmamtal practice of bitcoin which is (never expect anything unless on the long-term bases) must investors got in when the price was at its all-time high at the moment have lost a big percentage of the funds, but if the hold for the long term it could become a significant investment in the future.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: If you have been in Bitcoin for over 4 years and have passed through bull and bear markets, you have tasted the benefits of Bitcoin already, I don't see anyone who had already gotten into this phase backing away from Bitcoin and facing fiat again. 100% immutable.BTC is just more than a decade but once BTC has made one informed generation, the information will be passed on to the kids and to many generations to come.

Do you still believe the project will live better? What's your percentage trust?Those who withdrew from the Bitcoin communities did not know the value of Bitcoin and its decentralized advantages that changed the financial system and made it better without the control of the authorities and centralized banks. I am almost certain that this group has regretted their withdrawal from the Bitcoin market in the past years; now, as you can see, Bitcoin was able to live and coexist under harsh conditions, and its adoption increased on a broad level by businessmen and large companies, Bitcoin has become an integral part of our professional and investment lives, and no investor can do without it, as it is the leading and safest currency in the market. We trust and believe in Bitcoin, and this trust is the result of many factors and experiences. Bitcoin was able to make many millionaires and eradicate the lives of poverty, so I believe in Bitcoin by 101%, and I see that in the immediate future, we will witness an explosion in the price of Bitcoin.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Why shouldn't I? Is there any reason for me to back out since I've been here for years and the holding that I've got is still on my wallet even if a portion of it was sold and I've been satisfied with the profit that I've made. I'd always believe in bitcoin and that's why no matter what FUD I see and negative thoughts from billionaires or trillionaires all over the world, it won't matter. Anything they say on it, good or bad will just give exposure to bitcoin and that's the publicity that they'll give to it. So again, why I should stop believing in bitcoin if I know that it's on the right direction and this path is the correct path to be taken by someone who's seen the ups and downs of it?

I'd still be owning bitcoin even a country as big as the United States would ban it.Exactly!Anyone who has been in Bitcoin for a while and understands how it works, whatit offers and its future will only have more belief. Nothing has happened to knockthat belief.I think the OP is targeting others who bought the last big bullrun and are feeling a bit disillusioned because the markets didnt keep going up.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: The question is that if we don't still believe in Bitcoin then what coin are well going to believe in? It is very obvious that Bitcoin is everything we need for the market to go up and give up what we need. Those that think that Bitcoin is not for them can keep going in there ignorant perspective of buying crypto projects that may not last longer in the crypto market. It is not bad to hold some altcoins but we also need to hold the most essential coin in the market which is Bitcoin. There is nothing we can do about it we just need to keep holding for the better time the is coming ahead of us.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: I have "believed" in bitcoin since I first heard about it sometime in 2013-2014.  My problem has never ever been about my belief in bitcoin, my problem or worry completely in humanity.  As a financial advisor I obviously deal with peoples finances all day long and let me tell you the average person has almost zero financial savvy.  Even a massive percentage of people who own bitcoin have no idea how it works, why it's a breakthrough technology etc.  For this reason, I feel that bitcoin adoption faces headwinds..because there's still too many people who think the dollar and the old system is the only way, and always will be.  I still have faith in BTC, but I lost faith in humanity many years ago.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: I believe in Bitcoin, but when many of big countries are start to ban Bitcoin, I will sell my coin to prevent from possible huge lose in the future. But it doesn't mean I lost my trust in Bitcoin, I will buy Bitcoin when the price is cheaper due to government ban and panic. Even Bitcoin has been accepted as a legal tender in El Salvador and Central African Republic, but Bitcoin isn't still not safe for many countries. This year and next few years, we will see the future of Bitcoin, does it will be regulated or it will get banned.

comments.author: crypticj
comments.body: There is literally no reason to lose hope/believe in bitcoin. It just keeps getting better every year. We can see that adoption continues and more people are getting aware of what bitcoin is and what benefits it has. And, of course, the technology is still there and it's working great. Bitcoin is still the best decentralized currency in the world.

It is not controlled by any government making it very difficult to manipulate. It is not also controlled by any bank making it a beckon of freedom. Transactions are unlimited and unrestricted making it reliable. Transactions fees are not exploitative like bank controlled fiat. The anonymous and privacy features can make a billionaire live a humble life because nobody knows how much you are worth. The price might be unpredictable but it is better than some currencies that keeps losing value. I believe totally in the Bitcoin project.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: It's easier for people to feel they likely believe in Bitcoin in bull markets but it is harder for them to say they have such belief in bear markets.By that I meant, it's hard to find real Bitcoin believers and most of people only feel great and have unreal belief in bull markets that turn to be uncertainty and disbelief in bear markets.They can turn to be haters if they used leverages and got liquidations in bear markets. However it is not Bitcoin fault, people must change themselves first and strengthen their belief in Bitcoin. It needs time, patience, discipline and not easy.

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: My thoughts about the bitcoin are getting stronger day by day. In fact I am connected with bitcoin all the time. My fingers would automatically type word "bitcoin" every single day. I keep reading and posting news about the crypto space every single day without failing. That itself tells about my thoughts regarding bitcoin and crypto as whole. I am constantly seeking for newer ways to share the bitcoin with my inner circle and have chats about it all the time. Initially when I started with bitcoin it was really slow. I wasn't sure about it, but it was not long enough I boosted my investments, strategies and started playing along quickly. My thoughts have changed radically about bitcoin and they are mostly "positive".

comments.body: Quote from: Jawhead999 on March 02, 2023, 04:13:47 AMI believe in Bitcoin, but when many of big countries are start to ban Bitcoin, I will sell my coin to prevent from possible huge lose in the future. This year and next few years, we will see the future of Bitcoin, does it will be regulated or it will get banned.You don't have to wait a few more years, right now, you can see that countries are taking a more friendly view of bitcoin.
